title: ABA Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The Institute of Professional Practice (Stratford, CT) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially it was a phone interview which it went well. The interviewer and I scheduled a date and time to which we both agreed on. The day of the interview it was chaos and I did not know the precise Location of which to meet the interviewer and the receptionist was no help either. There were no customer skills at all. I arrived fifteen minutes prior the set date we made.  The interviewer came after 30 minutes to start the process to which she seemed disheveled. The interview took place in a computer room to which I sat on a low chair which I  did not mind. The interviewer concern was too much on my supervisory experience than the ones pertaining to the job I applied for. The interview last five minutes and next thing she is taking me to observe a child. I was not ready for an observation or to be observe on my job performance when I have no rapport with either child even with experience . All companies do things differently. Word s of advice from managemen: that is not how you adequately get people for the job. All companies especially from different states do things differently. When I train people I give them two weeks to build rapport with individuals or clients.
Interview Questions: Are you sure you want to step down from your role?

title: DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The Institute of Professional Practice (Meriden, CT) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was asked simple questions related to my experience. If you can relate any previous job to caring for others then you pretty much have the job. Everything else was very technical. They wanted to know if you would be alright to different background checks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work.

title: DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The Institute of Professional Practice (Meriden, CT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: There is a series of interviews to begin with before the hiring process begins. Then, they do an extensive background check on you. After that, they check your 3 references you have listed on your application. Then there's a drug and PPD testing that MUST be done within a 48 hour time frame (and that's only when they decide to administer it). Finally, assuming you've passed all the prehire requirements, there's a full week of training that you must pass. If you do not pass all the training exercises and testing, YOU WILL BE TERMINATED!!!
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with assisting individuals with personal Hygiene?

title: ABA Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The Institute of Professional Practice
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email that stated The Institute of Professional Practice was interested in hiring me and was shortly after taking in for an interview. The interview was somewhat easy, but I was very nervous because I thought this was a high end job (no way is it a high end job) and the beginning of my career (nope it wasn't), that paid very well (definitely mistaken). So I really wanted to make sure I didn't mess up, which of course caused me to feel pressured. 
In any rate, I got the job and my first day was about 3 weeks after the interview. 
Heads up: They do not tell you in the interview that you will be changing a lot of diapers, so if you have a phobia or a weak stomach for these kinds of things then run away as fast as you can. 
I never even wanted to change my younger sibling's diapers, let alone someone else's kid. Try taking a child, who has high level of autism, to the bathroom and see if it'll go well. 
Please speak to someone who already works here before you accept the job. Ask all the questions you can because you might just run away.
Interview Questions: Q: What are some of your experiences with being very organized and working as a team?

title: ABA Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The Institute of Professional Practice
Interview Descriptions: Lasted a month. Was a waste of time. Very unorganized. There are two interviewing steps. The job is very low pay and always need ABA therapist. If you make it to the second step to the interviewing process, don't think you got the job.
